question: In its March update, will Similarweb report deepseek.com being ranked in the top 50 globally?
description: [ChatGPT website traffic hits a new high, ranking sixth in the world](https://www.panewslab.com/en/articledetails/m015gje2.html)
fine_print: When accessing the rankings, ensure it is set to All Categories and Worldwide.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Who is the biggest loser after WeChat integrates DeepSeek?**
The integration of DeepSeek into WeChat has caused a stir in the industry, with some analysts predicting that Baidu will be the biggest loser. According to DeepSeek, Baidu's search market share has been declining, from 86.82% in 2021 to 60% in 2024, while platforms like WeChat and Xiaohongshu are gaining popularity through AI-powered search. DeepSeek believes that WeChat's integration with its model will reduce Baidu's dependence on traditional search and make it harder for Baidu to compete. 'Baidu faces multiple challenges from technology, ecosystem, and user habits, and if it cannot quickly transform, it may lose its competitiveness in the AI-driven search new era,' DeepSeek said. WeChat's version of DeepSeek may be more useful than the original DeepSeek, as it prioritizes WeChat's internal information sources and provides more accurate answers. For content creators, WeChat's integration with DeepSeek will shift their core competitiveness from simply chasing popularity to data-driven rapid iteration, with benefits including faster content creation, improved conversion efficiency, and AI-assisted content generation.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 17, 2025 02:34 AM
Source:[财经网](http://tech.caijing.com.cn/20250217/5070694.shtml)

**DeepSeek's Rise to the Top: A New Era for AI?**
DeepSeek, a Chinese AI company, has risen to the top of the AI industry with its new model R1, which has a cost advantage over OpenAI's ChatGPT. According to Sensor Tower data, DeepSeek's global download count reached 400 million by February 5, while ChatGPT's count was 410 million. DeepSeek's daily active users reached 221.5 million on January 31, accounting for 41.6% of ChatGPT's daily active users. DeepSeek's strategy of using a cost-effective approach has sparked controversy, with some questioning whether it uses OpenAI's data to train its models. OpenAI has accused DeepSeek of infringing on its intellectual property, while Microsoft is investigating whether DeepSeek uses its API. However, experts argue that DeepSeek's approach is not necessarily a bad thing, as it can help to democratize access to AI technology and reduce costs. DeepSeek's success has also raised concerns about the impact on traditional search engine companies and the demand for reasoning chips. As the AI industry continues to evolve, it remains to be seen how DeepSeek will navigate the challenges ahead and find a sustainable business model.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 17, 2025 02:05 AM
Source:[tmtpost.com](https://www.tmtpost.com/7455881.html)

**Zhongxin Securities: Positive on Top Companies' AI Applications**
A report by Zhongxin Securities suggests that the open-source ecosystem of Deepseek may accelerate the penetration and popularization of AI in application scenarios. We expect investment sentiment to continue to spread from the underlying hardware end to the application end, and Chinese internet assets may enter a value re-evaluation period. We recommend paying attention to two perspectives: 1) Chinese high-quality internet assets have a similar performance growth rate to their US counterparts, but have a significant undervaluation, and AI may become a catalyst for value re-evaluation; 2) the decline in marginal costs of large models will facilitate the flourishing of application scenarios, triggering a new round of internet innovation cycle. We are optimistic about the application landing of top companies in the AI direction and maintain a positive judgment on the 2025 valuation of top consumer internet companies.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 17, 2025 01:08 AM
Source:[每日经济新闻](https://www.nbd.com.cn/articles/2025-02-17/3753735.html)

**After taking on OpenAI and ChatGPT, DeepSeek coming for Google Search?**
Chinese AI startup DeepSeek is rapidly gaining traction in the AI sector, having disrupted OpenAI's dominance in AI assistants. With significant integrations in China's leading tech ecosystems, DeepSeek is now setting its sights on Google Search, intensifying the global AI competition. According to Reuters, DeepSeek has been integrated into Tencent's Weixin, China's largest messaging app, and Baidu, China's dominant search engine, marking a shift in the deployment of AI-powered search functions. DeepSeek's low-cost, high-efficiency AI model could appeal to enterprises and emerging markets looking for alternative search solutions. While Google remains the leader in search, DeepSeek's rapid adoption and efficiency could present an even bigger challenge, particularly in regions seeking AI-driven alternatives to conventional search engines.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 16, 2025 11:21 PM
Source:[Business Today](https://www.businesstoday.in/technology/news/story/after-taking-on-openai-and-chatgpt-deepseek-coming-for-google-search-464822-2025-02-17)

**Taiwan's Economy Minister: DeepSeek Will Not Threaten Taiwan's Semiconductor Industry**
Taiwan's economy minister, Guo Tai-hui, said that the rise of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI chip, will not threaten Taiwan's semiconductor industry. According to Guo, Taiwan has a strong foundation in semiconductor manufacturing and has developed AI high-efficiency chips with unique advantages and bargaining power. Taiwan's manufacturers believe that the long-term demand for AI will remain strong, and the cost of tariffs will be passed on to American companies. The Ministry of Economic Affairs stated that Taiwan's semiconductor manufacturing and American IC design are mutually beneficial and complementary. If the US imposes tariffs on Taiwan's semiconductors, the cost will be transferred to the product prices, and American companies may not benefit. To address the issue, the Ministry of Economic Affairs' deputy minister, Jiang Wen-ru, and the Industrial Development Bureau's deputy director, Chen Pei-li, have communicated with US officials. The US has imposed 10% tariffs on Chinese imports and 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico. The Ministry of Economic Affairs has stated that it will assist Taiwanese companies in adjusting their production lines and layouts in Mexico. Meanwhile, the rise of DeepSeek has surprised the world, and its true nature remains a mystery. Guo Tai-hui said that this is beneficial to Taiwan, and if DeepSeek can achieve similar effects to ChatGPT through software alone, Taiwan may be able to learn from it. The Ministry of Economic Affairs has tasked its technology department with analyzing DeepSeek's open-source code to confirm whether it is true. If so, Taiwan will take advantage of its strengths and expand AI applications in various industries. Taiwan aims to become a top AI nation and has strengthened its AI software applications. The Ministry of Economic Affairs is also planning to attract digital immigrants to Taiwan and has discussed tax incentives with the Ministry of Finance. Taiwan has been rapidly expanding its computing power, with a current capacity of 103 PF (every second trillion floating-point operations). The global computing power ranking has Taiwan at 11th place, with the US at 1st place (6475 PF), Japan at 2nd place (940 PF), and Italy at 3rd place (849 PF). Taiwan's public and private sectors have collaborated on large-scale computing power construction projects, with a total capacity of 300 PF expected this year, 1000 PF in 2028, and 1200 PF in 2029. Taiwan has also been continuously developing AI chips, with the Ministry of Economic Affairs and the National Science Council cooperating to establish the 'Taiwan Artificial Intelligence Chip Alliance' in 2019. One of the key focuses is the development of 'half-universal AI chips,' which can satisfy multiple functions with a single chip. For example, AI image recognition chips can simultaneously handle dynamic and static image recognition. The technology department stated that developing high-efficiency and low-power AI chips is necessary, and the Industrial Technology Research Institute has developed a magnetic memory (MRAM) technology that can be miniaturized to advanced processes, with a performance advantage of 40% over Korean manufacturers. This technology can be used for 'memory-based computing' and has been adopted by Taiwan's leading manufacturers.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 16, 2025 09:37 PM
Source:[自由時報電子報](https://ec.ltn.com.tw/article/paper/1692109)

**Who is the Biggest Loser with WeChat's Integration of DeepSeek?**
The integration of DeepSeek into WeChat has caused a stir, with many analysts predicting that Baidu will be the biggest loser. According to DeepSeek, Baidu's search market share has been declining, from 86.82% in 2021 to 60% in 2024, while platforms like WeChat and Xiaohongshu are gaining traction with AI-powered search. DeepSeek believes that WeChat's integration with its model will make it easier for users to get accurate answers within the ecosystem, further reducing Baidu's dependence on traditional search. Additionally, WeChat's vast content library, combined with DeepSeek's semantic understanding and personalized recommendation capabilities, will activate long-tail content and enable 'search as a service' (e.g., direct calls to mini-programs). Baidu lacks a similar content ecosystem and is unlikely to compete. 'This wave means one thing: stationing oneself,' said an analyst. 'If the global path chosen by WeChat, with over 10 billion users, is to seal the deal, then it's just a matter of waiting for the feast.' Despite Baidu's announcement that its Wenxin Big Model will be available for free from April 1, it may be too little, too late. WeChat's low-cost integration with DeepSeek has enabled a technological leap, while Baidu is likely to fall behind in data integration and user experience. DeepSeek believes that Baidu faces a triple threat of technology, ecosystem, and user habit disruption, and may lose competitiveness in the AI-driven search era unless it can quickly adapt.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 16, 2025 01:54 PM
Source:[和讯网](http://tech.hexun.com/2025-02-16/217357624.html)

**Who is the biggest loser after WeChat integrates DeepSeek? DeepSeek says it's Baidu!**
The integration of DeepSeek into WeChat has caused a stir in the industry, with some analysts predicting that it will lead to a significant shift in the search landscape. According to DeepSeek, Baidu is the biggest loser in this scenario, as WeChat's integration of DeepSeek will make it easier for users to get accurate answers within the WeChat ecosystem, reducing their reliance on traditional search engines like Baidu. DeepSeek believes that Baidu's search market share has been declining, from 86.82% in 2021 to 60% in 2024, while platforms like WeChat and Xiaohongshu are gaining traction with AI-powered search. WeChat's integration of DeepSeek will also enable users to access high-quality content within the platform, further eroding Baidu's dominance. 'WeChat's move means 'stationing oneself at the side', ' said an analyst. 'If the global ten billion users of WeChat choose this path, it's like nailing down the coffin lid and waiting for the feast.' DeepSeek also believes that Baidu's Wenxin Big Model, which was announced to be free from April 1, may be too little, too late. WeChat's low-cost integration of DeepSeek will give it a significant technological advantage, while Baidu will struggle to keep up with data integration and user experience. 'Baidu faces multiple challenges from technology, ecosystem, and user habits, and if it cannot quickly transform, it may lose its competitiveness in the AI-driven search new era,' said DeepSeek.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 16, 2025 10:30 AM
Source:[新浪财经](https://finance.sina.com.cn/tech/shenji/2025-02-16/doc-ineksnvc8990307.shtml)

**US Leads AI Development, but China's Deepseek Challenges Sustainability**
The United States currently leads the development of artificial intelligence (AI), according to the University of Stanford's ranking. The US sector has received eight times more private capital than China in 2023, and has created nearly seven out of every ten large language models. The US also designs and produces the most powerful microchips, the engines that drive technology, and has the greatest capacity for data storage, the raw material of AI. US companies, such as OpenAI, Nvidia, Google, and Amazon, dominate the sector. According to Judith Arnal, a researcher at the Instituto Elcano, 'the US model is characterized by a certain techno-optimism, which allows the free market to operate without a strict regulatory framework.' However, the emergence of the Chinese company Deepseek has challenged the sustainability of the US model, as it has achieved similar performance to its US competitors at a lower cost, energy consumption, and computational power. Additionally, the removal of regulatory frameworks by Donald Trump could undermine confidence in US AI models.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 16, 2025 05:13 AM
Source:[El Periódico](https://www.elperiodico.com/es/internacional/eeuu-ue-china-control-ia-sh/)

**What Chinese media and experts are saying on AI disruptor DeepSeek - The Sunday Guardian Live**
Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has made a significant impact in the tech sector with its 'low-cost + open-source' model, causing a $1 trillion decline in U.S. tech companies' market value. DeepSeek's emergence as a formidable competitor has challenged Western AI dominance and is poised to play a crucial role in shaping China's future tech landscape. The startup's success has been described as a 'technological breakthrough' and has compelled leading Chinese and global tech giants to integrate DeepSeek-R1/V3 inference services into their cloud platforms. According to Xinhua, DeepSeek operates at 1/18th of the training cost of ChatGPT-4o, with a team one-tenth the size, while delivering comparable model performance. DeepSeek's API pricing is significantly lower than ChatGPT, allowing it to disrupt the Western 'cash-burning business model' with its 'optimum training costs and computational efficiency.' The startup's performance has been compared to ChatGPT-4o across various benchmarks, with DeepSeek-R1 surpassing OpenAI's o1-1217 score in AIME 2024 and MATH-500. DeepSeek's success has also raised concerns over data security and cybersecurity, with several governments and enterprises restricting or banning access to the model. However, China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson has emphasized the country's commitment to data privacy and security.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 15, 2025 08:29 PM
Source:[The Sunday Guardian Live](https://sundayguardianlive.com/opinion/what-chinese-media-and-experts-are-saying-on-ai-disruptor-deepseek)

**DeepSeek: China's ChatGPT Moment, AI Android Era Arrives**
DeepSeek, a Chinese AI model, is rapidly expanding its ecosystem globally, particularly in China. In January 2025, US tech giants NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Amazon announced their integration with DeepSeek. Following this, Huawei, Baidu, Tencent, Alibaba, JD.com, and ByteDance, among other cloud computing companies, announced their integration with DeepSeek in February. The chip, operating system, and computing device industries are all adapting to or integrating with DeepSeek. As of February 10, numerous car manufacturers, including Geely, Geely's luxury brand, and BYD, have integrated their smart cockpits with DeepSeek. Even smartphone manufacturers like Huawei, Honor, OPPO, Vivo, and Meizu have officially announced their integration with DeepSeek. The rapid expansion of DeepSeek's ecosystem has garnered significant attention. Since the release of DeepSeek-V3 and DeepSeek R1, the model has received high praise from domestic and international tech professionals and business leaders. Feng Ji, founder and CEO of Game Science, stated, 'DeepSeek may be a national-level technological achievement, with its strong and affordable features being its main characteristics.' DeepSeek-R1 has comparable reasoning capabilities to OpenAI's o1, with a training cost of over $5 million, significantly lower than OpenAI's cost. Despite being based on Google's Transformer architecture from 2017, DeepSeek has achieved low-cost high-performance through a series of algorithmic and engineering innovations, such as MoE expert models, low-rank attention mechanisms, reinforcement learning, small model distillation, and FP8 mixed precision.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 13, 2025 06:45 PM
Source:[中华网科技公司](https://news.china.com/socialgd/10000169/20250214/47968327.html)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google Gemini and Character.AI in Global Visits, According to SimilarWeb**
DeepSeek, a popular AI chatbot, has rapidly risen to become the second most visited AI chatbot globally, surpassing Google's Gemini and Character.AI, according to data from website tracking company SimilarWeb. This comes just two months after its launch. DeepSeek's V3 model has outperformed Meta's Llama 3.1, OpenAI's GPT-4o, and Alibaba's Qwen 2.5 in third-party benchmark tests, with a significantly lower cost, contributing to its surge in popularity. SimilarWeb's data shows that DeepSeek.com reached a record 49 million visits on February 1, a 614% increase from the previous week. This number does not include app-based traffic, highlighting the rapid growth of DeepSeek. A month ago, the website's daily visits were only 3 million, but by February 1, this number had skyrocketed to 33.4 million, causing a stir in the US tech market. DeepSeek's daily visits have now surpassed Gemini's 10 million and Character.AI's 6 million, but still lag behind OpenAI's ChatGPT, which receives between 130-140 million visits per day. Additionally, DeepSeek's visits are lower than Microsoft's Bing.com, which integrates OpenAI's Copilot AI. Since DeepSeek released its open-source V3 model, its popularity has skyrocketed. The V3 model's training cost was only $5.5 million, significantly lower than the typical investment of US companies. The V3 model has similar functions to ChatGPT and can be downloaded for free and run on local servers, making it an attractive option for businesses looking to integrate AI technology at a lower cost. SimilarWeb's latest data shows that as of February 2, global visits to DeepSeek.com have stabilized at 29.2 million. In the US, the platform reached a daily visit peak of 4.9 million on January 28, before dropping to 2.4 million on January 31.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 08, 2025 06:37 AM
Source:[动点科技](https://cn.technode.com/post/2025-02-08/deepseek-official-website-global-daily-visits-have-exceeded-google-gemini/)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google Gemini and Character.AI in Global Daily Visits**
DeepSeek, a popular AI chatbot, has surpassed Google's Gemini and Character.AI in global daily visits, according to data from website tracking company SimilarWeb. This comes just two months after its launch, and a week after it surpassed ChatGPT as the top-rated free app in the Apple US App Store. DeepSeek's V3 model has outperformed Meta's Llama 3.1, OpenAI's GPT-4o, and Alibaba's Qwen 2.5 in third-party benchmark tests, and at a significantly lower cost, which has led to its rapid growth in popularity. SimilarWeb's data shows that DeepSeek.com reached a record 49 million visits on February 1, a 614% increase from the previous week. This number does not include app-based traffic, highlighting the platform's rapid growth. One month ago, the website's daily visits were only 3 million, but by January 27, this number had skyrocketed to 33.4 million, causing a stir in the US tech market. DeepSeek's daily visits have now surpassed Google's Gemini (approximately 10 million) and Character.AI (approximately 6 million), but still lag behind OpenAI's ChatGPT, which receives between 130-140 million visits per day. Additionally, DeepSeek's visits are lower than Microsoft's Bing.com, which integrates OpenAI's Copilot AI. Since DeepSeek released its open-source V3 model, its popularity has surged. The V3 model was trained at a cost of $5.5 million, significantly lower than the typical investment of US companies. The V3 model has similar functions to ChatGPT and can be downloaded for free and run on a local server, making it an attractive option for businesses looking to integrate AI technology at a lower cost. SimilarWeb's latest data shows that as of February 2, global visits to DeepSeek.com have stabilized at 29.2 million. In the US, the platform reached a daily visit peak of 4.9 million on January 28, before dropping to 2.4 million on January 31.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 08, 2025 04:32 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://tech.ifeng.com/c/8gno3ulBpkc)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google's Gemini in User Count in Just One Week**
According to SimilarWeb, a research company, DeepSeek's user count surpassed Google's Gemini chat AI in just one week. On January 31, DeepSeek.com had 2.4 million daily visits in the US, a 60% increase over Gemini's 1.5 million visits. OpenAI's ChatGPT still leads with 19.3 million daily visits, eight times that of DeepSeek. The gap between DeepSeek and Gemini is even larger outside the US: SimilarWeb's data shows that on January 31, DeepSeek had 29.2 million global visits (excluding China), more than three times that of Gemini.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 07, 2025 03:28 AM
Source:[新浪财经](https://finance.sina.com.cn/stock/relnews/us/2025-02-07/doc-ineirmwh0202820.shtml)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google Gemini in US Visits, Shows Rapid Growth**
According to data from SimilarWeb, a research institution, DeepSeek's website had 2.4 million visits in the US on January 31, surpassing Google Gemini's 1.5 million visits by 60%. The gap between DeepSeek and Gemini was even larger in regions outside of the US, with DeepSeek having 29.2 million visits globally (excluding China), which is more than three times that of Gemini. In just one week, DeepSeek's user base surpassed that of Google Gemini, which has been around for nearly two years. 'DeepSeek's rapid growth is a testament to its popularity and potential,' said a SimilarWeb spokesperson.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 07, 2025 01:43 AM
Source:[和讯网](http://tech.hexun.com/2025-02-07/217146196.html)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google Gemini in US Visits, Dominates Globally**
According to data from SimilarWeb, a research institution, DeepSeek's website had 2.4 million visits in the US on January 31, surpassing Google's Gemini website by 60% with 1.5 million visits. The gap between DeepSeek and Gemini is even larger in regions outside of the US, with DeepSeek having 29.2 million visits globally (excluding China) on January 31, more than three times Gemini's visits. In just one week, DeepSeek's user base surpassed that of Google's Gemini, which has been around for nearly two years.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 07, 2025 01:14 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://tech.ifeng.com/c/8glxsO3Cq1q)

**DeepSeek Surpasses Google's Gemini in User Count**
According to SimilarWeb, a research company, DeepSeek's user count surpassed Google's Gemini chat AI in just one week. On January 31st, DeepSeek.com had 2.4 million daily visits in the US, a 60% increase over Gemini's 1.5 million visits. OpenAI's ChatGPT still leads with 19.3 million daily visits, eight times that of DeepSeek. The gap between DeepSeek and Gemini is even larger outside of the US, with SimilarWeb's data showing that on January 31st, DeepSeek had 29.2 million global visits (excluding China), more than three times that of Gemini. 'DeepSeek has quickly gained popularity and surpassed Gemini in just a short period of time,' said a spokesperson for the company. 'We are committed to providing the best AI experience for our users and will continue to innovate and improve our technology.'
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 07, 2025 12:39 AM
Source:[东方财富网](https://finance.eastmoney.com/a/202502073312808844.html)

**Alibaba's Qwen2.5-Max Enters Top 10 Global Model Rankings, Surpassing DeepSeek V3**
The latest global top 10 model rankings have been released, with Google's Gemini-2.0-Flash-Thinking-Exp-01-21 and Gemini-Exp-1206 taking the top two spots. OpenAI's ChatGPT-4o-latest (2024-11-20) and DeepSeek's DeepSeek-R1 are tied for third. Notably, Alibaba's Qwen2.5-Max has entered the top 10, ranking 7th, surpassing DeepSeek V3, o1-Mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet. Qwen2.5-Max has shown excellent performance in the technical domain, ranking 1st in mathematics and programming, and 2nd in handling complex tasks with fixed prompts. This marks another important breakthrough for China's AI industry in high-performance and low-cost technology. Market analysts believe that Qwen2.5-Max's performance, combined with its low-cost advantage and complete cloud ecosystem, may trigger a new round of re-evaluation of China's AI assets, following DeepSeek. Qwen2.5-Max has attracted widespread attention from users and developers worldwide since its release. Some users have praised its capabilities, saying it is equivalent to a Chinese version of ChatGPT but with higher levels of performance. Others have noted that it has surpassed OpenAI's Sora in video generation capabilities. 'Qwen2.5-Max has redefined the video generation function and has surpassed OpenAI's Sora,' said one user. Another user joked that Qwen2.5-Max has 'knocked ChatGPT and DeepSeek to the ground.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 07:45 AM
Source:[自由時報電子報](https://ec.ltn.com.tw/article/breakingnews/4942080)

**The New Geography of Artificial Intelligence: DeepSeek's Rise to the Top**
There are approximately 1 million AI platforms worldwide, with 50% being of Chinese origin. Europe is lagging behind, with only 8 companies in the top 50 global rankings. However, a recent development has seen DeepSeek, a 2023-founded company, take the lead in global AI platform research and downloads, including in the US. DeepSeek's R1 model has shown impressive performance in complex areas such as mathematics and coding, outperforming Chat GPT. According to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, DeepSeek is 'impressive'. What's more impressive is that DeepSeek is significantly cheaper than other similar models, with a price of $0.55 per entry, compared to OpenAI's $15. Additionally, DeepSeek is an open-source platform, allowing for customization and making users more dependent on the ecosystem. The impact of DeepSeek's market penetration has been significant, contributing to a sudden drop in the stock prices of many Nasdaq-listed companies, including NVIDIA, which lost more value in a single day than the total investment in the Stargate project. The question is whether the Western world has been distracted, as this is not an isolated case. China's geographical and cultural distance may contribute to the general lack of knowledge, but this is part of a larger strategy that began around 2000, known as the 'new silk road', which started with Huawei and focuses on brand value rather than just production.
Original language: pt
Publish date: February 04, 2025 06:30 AM
Source:[linktoleaders.com](https://linktoleaders.com/a-nova-geografia-da-inteligencia-artificial-pedro-celeste-pca/)

**DeepSeek Downloads Reach 140 Countries' Top Spot, Global Fever Continues**
DeepSeek, a reasoning-type AI chatbot developed by DeepSeek, has gained widespread attention globally. Since its release at the beginning of this year, it has rapidly climbed to the top of the Apple App Store download charts in 140 countries and also occupied the top spot in the US Android Play Store. According to data from market analysis company Appfigures, DeepSeek's application first topped the Apple App Store on January 26 and has maintained its global leading position since then. India has become the driving force behind the growth of new users for this app, with its downloads accounting for 15.6% of total downloads across all platforms, demonstrating the significant influence and popularity of DeepSeek in the Indian market. In the 18 days following its release, DeepSeek achieved an astonishing 16 million downloads, nearly twice the download count of its competitor OpenAI's ChatGPT during the same period, showcasing its strong market appeal and user base. In the US Android Play Store, DeepSeek has been consistently ranked number one since January 28, further solidifying its leading position globally.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 02, 2025 10:24 AM
Source:[中华网科技公司](https://news.china.com/socialgd/10000169/20250202/47925295.html)

**DeepSeek Becomes Top Downloaded App Globally, with 15.6% of Downloads Coming from India**
DeepSeek, a Chinese AI language model developed by the company of the same name, has become the top downloaded app in the world, with 15.6% of its downloads coming from India. According to data from Appfigures, DeepSeek has maintained its position as the number one downloaded app globally since January 26, with the highest download rate coming from India. Sensor Tower's research also shows that DeepSeek has performed well in the US Android Play Store, with a download rate of 16 million in just 18 days, nearly double that of OpenAI's ChatGPT in its first 18 days. DeepSeek's success has sparked curiosity and surprise, as it was developed at a low cost and has achieved performances comparable to top-tier AI chatbots. However, DeepSeek still lags behind ChatGPT in terms of total user numbers, and due to concerns over network security, many companies and governments have begun to block DeepSeek, which may hinder its growth. 'It seems that DeepSeek's success shows that it is not necessary to invest heavily in hardware to develop AI chatbots,' said a spokesperson. 'However, we must also consider the potential risks and challenges that come with this technology.'
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 02, 2025 09:34 AM
Source:[NOWnews 今日新聞](https://www.nownews.com/news/6641485)

**DeepSeek App Holds Top Global Spot in Downloads, Led by India**
DeepSeek's AI assistant has held the top spot in global downloads across 140 markets since January 26, according to Appfigures data. The app rose to the No. 1 position on Apple Inc.'s App Store and has maintained its lead. India accounted for 15.6% of all downloads across platforms since the app's launch, contributing the largest percentage of new users. As of February 1, DeepSeek has maintained its position at the top of the list, with no change in its ranking.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 01, 2025 01:47 AM
Source:[Bloomberg Business](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-02-01/deepseek-app-holds-top-global-spot-in-downloads-led-by-india)

**3 Top-Ranked Semiconductor Stocks to Buy Despite DeepSeek Disruption**
Despite the disruption caused by DeepSeek's low-cost AI models, NVIDIA NVDA, Broadcom AVGO, and Amphenol APH are expected to continue their momentum. DeepSeek's models are gaining attention for their efficient performance at low costs and energy use. The company's latest open-source model, DeepSeek-R1-Zero and DeepSeek-R1, showed similar performance to that of Microsoft-backed OpenAI's reasoning models and Meta Platforms' META Llama models on leading benchmarks. According to the author, 'We expect U.S. tech giants to continue their spending momentum as models become more complex and deployment time reduces drastically.' The author believes that Amphenol, Broadcom, and NVIDIA are well-positioned to benefit from the increasing deployment of AI and Generative AI (GenAI) technology. Amphenol's diversified business model lowers the volatility of individual end markets and geographies, while Broadcom is benefiting from strong demand for its networking products and custom AI accelerators. NVIDIA is expected to continue benefiting from accelerating usage of its GPUs, including Hopper and Ampere architectures.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 06:01 PM
Source:[NASDAQ Stock Market](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/3-top-ranked-semiconductor-stocks-buy-despite-deepseek-disruption)

**China’s DeepSeek surpasses ChatGPT in US app downloads**
China's homegrown AI model, DeepSeek, has surpassed ChatGPT in US app downloads and secured the top spot in China's free app rankings. DeepSeek-R1, the latest AI model from DeepSeek, ranked third globally in benchmark tests and tied with OpenAI's o1 in the style control model category. The release of DeepSeek-R1 has sent shockwaves through the US tech industry due to its exceptional performance at a low cost and its open-source nature. According to Alexandr Wang, CEO of Scale AI, DeepSeek's AI model performance is on par with the best models from the US, which could 'change everything'. Meanwhile, Meta plans to spend over $60 billion on a massive data center to power its newest AI model, Llama 4, and Nvidia's shares dropped by 3.12 percent amid concerns over an AI bubble.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 12:05 AM
Source:[asianews.network](https://asianews.network/chinas-deepseek-surpasses-chatgpt-in-us-app-downloads/)

**DeepSeek, Chinese AI Model, Surpasses ChatGPT in AI World**
DeepSeek, a Chinese AI model, has become the new top performer in the AI world, surpassing ChatGPT, the previous paradigm. According to Apple's app store, DeepSeek is currently ranked second, behind the KNMI's new weather app and ahead of Signal. DeepSeek works similarly to ChatGPT and other chatbots, answering user questions and summarizing documents, but it has managed to outperform its American counterparts, including Claude and Gemini. As the article states, 'In de basis doet DeepSeek hetzelfde als ChatGPT of andere chatbots: de gebruiker stelt een vraag en het AI-model geeft antwoord.'
Original language: nl
Publish date: January 27, 2025 04:14 PM
Source:[nd.nl](https://www.nd.nl/nieuws/buitenland/1255452/triomftocht-chinese-chatgpt-concurrent-deepseek-zorgt-voor-sc)

**DeepSeek's Rise to Prominence: A Challenge to US AI Dominance?**
DeepSeek, a Chinese AI model, has recently gained popularity and reached the 6th position on the Apple App Store's free ranking list in the US, surpassing Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot. The model's low cost and high performance have caused concern among Meta employees, with one employee stating that the company is in a state of panic. The employee claimed that DeepSeek-V3 has surpassed Meta's Llama 4 in benchmark tests. Alexandr Wang, the founder of Scale AI, stated that DeepSeek's AI model is comparable to the best models in the US. Meanwhile, 360 company founder Zhou Hongyi described DeepSeek as 'suddenly reversing the situation' and believes that it will play a key role in the 'Chinese model technology revenge team' against US AI technology hegemony.
